info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 30 at 1:37PM EDT until September 30 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Berkeley County in southeastern South Carolina... Charleston County in southeastern South Carolina... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 124 PM EDT, Charleston Police reported that the Crosstown and numerous streets across Downtown Charleston were closed due to flooding. This flooding was a result of 5 to 8 inches of rainfall that has fallen across downtown so far today. Radar estimated rainfall across West Ashley to James Island was around 8 to 9 inches. At 135 PM, a band of heavy torrential rainfall was over Charleston, this band may shift to Mount Pleasant by 2 PM. This band may produce an additional 1 to 3 inches of rain. Moderate rain will likely linger through mid afternoon. In addition, at 125 PM, the observed water level on Church Creek near West Ashley was 5.66 ft and rising, flood stage is 5.5 ft. At flood stage, Church Creek will flood portions of Winners Circle and water will approach the Crosstowne Church. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, James Island, West Ashley, Daniel Island, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Fort Sumter, Johns Island, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Charles Towne Landing, Charleston Naval Complex, Maybank Bridge, James Island County Park, Fort Johnson, Don Holt Bridge and Sullivans Island. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
